title: Wetlands: Nature's Water Filters
description: A fast breakdown of Wetlands: Nature's Water Filters for builders.

hook.text: Wetlands look like muddy wastelands. They are actually among Earth's most valuable ecosystems.

buildup.text: They filter pollutants, absorb floodwater, and recharge underground aquifers naturally.

discovery.text: A single acre of wetland can store over 1 million gallons of floodwater.

twist.text: Humans have destroyed over 85% of the world's wetlands since 1700 â€” faster than forests.

climax.text: Restoring wetlands costs a fraction of building equivalent water treatment plants.

punchline.text: The best water filter on Earth looks like a swamp.
